body:
@erjieyong I wasn't able to reproduce the issue. Here's the code I used:

```python
import mlflow
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris

mlflow.set_tracking_uri("sqlite:///mlflow.db")
mlflow.set_experiment("project-2")
mlflow.autolog()

lr_baseline = LinearRegression()
lr_baseline.fit(*load_iris(return_X_y=True, as_frame=True))
```

Can you try running this code?

I created a branch for debugging. Can you install mlflow using the following command? This mlflow throws (not warns) when logging model metadata failed.

```
pip install git+https://github.com/harupy/mlflow.git@issue-6877
```

Commit: https://github.com/harupy/mlflow/commit/934835e086dd7b604e9c6b0f28104abb9313bb6c

Hi, I have run the code, but am still seeing the following code.

```

    371 if input_schema is not None:

    544             message += " Note that there were extra inputs: {0}".format(extra_cols)
--> 545         raise MlflowException(message)

    548     num_actual_columns = len(pfInput.columns)

The error indicate `df_submit_org` is missing the inputs. Are you sure `df_submit_org` has the same columns as the data the model was trained on?

Hi @harupy , kindly ignore my issue as the issue disappeared after i uninstall and reinstall mlflow. Thanks for your assitance.

But before i close this, is there any way to remove the warning as such? it still keep appearing.
```

link to the necessary files as follows: https://we.tl/t-pbEKtVSE9B

<!-- assign-maintainer -->
@BenWilson2 @dbczumar @harupy @WeichenXu123 Please assign a maintainer and start triaging this issue.

@erjieyong 

You can ignore the warning using `filterwarnings`:

```python
import warnings

warnings.filterwarnings(action='ignore', module="mlflow.models.model")
```
Hi harupy, while i can ignore the warning. I would like to still be able to log the metadata. Is there a way to do it?
Can you upgrade the tracking server to a more recent version? (note: you'll likely need to do a schema migration for the tracking server's tables to support the newer functionality)

I get the same warning. After setting the logging level to DEBUG, I get the following exception:

```
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Tag value '[{"run_id": "4ac6979052cb4e85ab76f75631171521", "artifact_path": "model", "utc_time_created": "2022-11-03 09:23:15.313642", "flavors": {"python_function": {"model_path": "model.pkl", "predict_fn": "predict", "loader_module": "mlflow.sklearn", "python' had length 6484, which exceeded length limit of 5000
```

The important part is probably: `had length 6484, which exceeded length limit of 5000`

**For me, it looks like large signatures are not supported.** 

A few more notes:
 - My model has 153 features as input.
 - When I reduce the number of features to 11, the warning and exception disappears.
 - I use `mlflow.sklearn.autolog()` 
 - When I do not log the signature, i.e., when I use `mlflow.sklearn.autolog(log_model_signatures=False)` , the warning and exception disappears.
 - I tried using a remote tracking server and a local SQlite DB, the same `MlflowException` exception gets raised. 

This stackoverflow issue seems related https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72416831/mlflow-saving-signature-gives-me-warning (but has no solution either)
@OliverBaumfeld can you include the full stack trace and example repro code please?
